text.description:
Regex pattern to match the text key of the cast.
**Note:** 
1) Regex must be parsed by Go's RE2 engine (Test your expression here: https://www.lddgo.net/en/string/golangregex)
2) Use backslashes to escape special characters.
For example: (?i)\\$degen should be written as (?i)\\\\$degen

embeds.description:
Regex pattern to match the embeded_url (key embeds) of the cast.
**Note:** 
1) Regex must be parsed by Go's RE2 engine (Test your expression here: https://www.lddgo.net/en/string/golangregex)
2) Use backslashes to escape special characters.
For example: \\b(farcaster|neynar)\\b should be written as \\\\b(farcaster|neynar)\\\\b

get.summary: Fetches users based on Eth or Sol addresses
get.description:
Fetches all users based on multiple Ethereum or Solana addresses.

Each farcaster user has a custody Ethereum address and optionally verified Ethereum or Solana addresses. This endpoint returns all users that have any of the given addresses as their custody or verified Ethereum or Solana addresses.

A custody address can be associated with only 1 farcaster user at a time but a verified address can be associated with multiple users.
You can pass in Ethereum and Solana addresses, comma separated, in the same request. The response will contain users associated with the given addresses.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: Comma separated list of Ethereum addresses, up to 350 at a time

parameters.name: address_types
parameters.description: Customize which address types the request should search for. This is a comma-separated string that can include the following values: 'custody_address' and 'verified_address'. By default api returns both. To select multiple types, use a comma-separated list of these values.

parameters.name: feed_type
parameters.description: Defaults to following (requires fid or address). If set to filter (requires filter_type)

parameters.name: filter_type
parameters.description: Used when feed_type=filter. Can be set to fids (requires fids) or parent_url (requires parent_url) or channel_id (requires channel_id)

parameters.name: fid
parameters.description: (Optional) fid of user whose feed you want to create. By default, the API expects this field, except if you pass a filter_type

parameters.name: fids
parameters.description: Used when filter_type=fids . Create a feed based on a list of fids. Max array size is 250. Requires feed_type and filter_type.

parameters.name: parent_url
parameters.description: Used when filter_type=parent_url can be used to fetch content under any parent url e.g. FIP-2 channels on Warpcast. Requires feed_type and filter_type

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: Used when filter_type=channel_id can be used to fetch all casts under a channel. Requires feed_type and filter_type

parameters.name: embed_url
parameters.description: Used when filter_type=embed_url can be used to fetch all casts with an embed url that contains embed_url. Requires feed_type and filter_type

parameters.name: with_recasts
parameters.description: Include recasts in the response, true by default

parameters.description: Number of results to retrieve (default 25, max 100)
